conclusion: Analyze the acceleration-time graph to determine the distance traveled by the car within 0 to 60 seconds.
The graph shows the car accelerates for 30 seconds, then decelerates for another 30 seconds.
Calculate velocity after the first 30 seconds using v = u + at with u = 0, a = 2 m/s², t = 30 s.
Velocity after the first 30 seconds is v1 = 60 m/s.
Calculate distance during the first 30 seconds using s = ut + 1/2 at².
Distance during the first 30 seconds is s1 = 900 m.
Calculate velocity after the second 30 seconds using v = v1 + at with v1 = 60 m/s, a = -1 m/s², t = 30 s.
Velocity after the second 30 seconds is v2 = 30 m/s.
Calculate distance during the deceleration phase using s = v1t + 1/2 at².
Distance during the deceleration phase is s2 = 1350 m.
Calculate total distance traveled as s_total = s1 + s2.
Total distance traveled in 60 seconds is s_total = 2250 m.
